level.text: Each applicant for a license as master electrician shall furnish evidence of either of the following:
That he or she has worked as an electrician, as that term is defined in this chapter, for not less than four (4) years; or

Equivalent experience which may include work in the United States Armed Services or Merchant Marine, or attendance at a college or university in a course of electrical engineering for four (4) years; Provided, that the applicant can show at least two (2) years of practical experience in electrical work.
The examination shall include the following:

A practical knowledge of the Electrical Code and regulations applicable to electrical installations, wiring methods, types and current carrying capacities of conductors, conductor and equipment protection, and standard wiring systems and diagrams; and

A demonstration by the applicant to the examining board of an ability to comprehend and interpret electrical wiring plans and drawings, to maintain electrical installations, and to repair apparatus, equipment, fixtures, and appliances in accordance with the D.C. Electrical Code and established standards.
The examination may include all of the subjects listed in ยง216.2 or may be limited to the scope of work included in the license application.
